message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with distributed storage codes, which are codes used for storing data across multiple nodes in a network. This topic falls under the category of Information Theory (cs.IT). The paper specifically focuses on regenerating codes, which are a type of distributed storage code, and their ability to perform exact repair without arithmetic operations. This suggests that the paper may also fall under the sub-category of Distributed Systems (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the tradeoff between storage and bandwidth, which is a common topic in the sub-category of Signal Processing (cs.SI). Additionally, the paper mentions the concept of helper node pooling, which is related to network coding and may place the paper in the sub-category of Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI). Finally, the paper may also fall under the sub-category of Computational Complexity (cs.CC) due to its analysis of the achievability of certain points on the storage-bandwidth tradeoff.
